channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12195] Fix dev-support/findHangingTests
item.description: The existing script findHangingTests.sh fails to actually find hanging tests. Fixing it by replacing it with findHangingTests.py.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This patch replaces the existing fixHangingTest.sh with fixHangingTest.sh which searches the entire webpage and finds all the hanging tests. I also verified that the fixHangingTest.sh reports tests which actually finish execution later on.

I tried this command:
python dev-support/findHangingTests.py https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5622/consoleFull


Hanging test : org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint

The console output has some more details:


Tests run: 7, Failures: 0, Errors: 5, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 317.124 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint

testRegionReplicaReplicationIgnoresDisabledTables(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint)  Time elapsed: 60.061 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.lang.Exception: test timed out after 60000 milliseconds

	at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:483)

	at org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.getLong(Configuration.java:1147)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner.<init>(StoreScanner.java:130)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner.<init>(StoreScanner.java:167)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HStore.getScanner(HStore.java:1890)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion$RegionScannerImpl.<init>(HRegion.java:4032)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.instantiateRegionScanner(HRegion.java:2109)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.getScanner(HRegion.java:2095)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.getScanner(HRegion.java:2072)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.get(HRegion.java:5014)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.get(HRegion.java:4988)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.verifyNumericRows(HBaseTestingUtility.java:1933)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint$1.evaluate(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:199)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:177)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:128)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.verifyReplication(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:194)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.testRegionReplicaReplicationIgnoresDisabledTables(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:337)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.testRegionReplicaReplicationIgnoresDisabledTables(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:264)



testRegionReplicaReplicationWith3Replicas(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint)  Time elapsed: 60.045 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.lang.Exception: test timed out after 60000 milliseconds

	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:181)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:128)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.verifyReplication(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:194)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.testRegionReplicaReplication(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:164)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.testRegionReplicaReplicationWith3Replicas(TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint.java:219)

Is it possible to include part of the failure report ?
Sure. I can make that change and upload the patch. I currently didn't handle failures correctly. Let me fix that.

Tried the script on:
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/11237/consoleFull


Hanging test : org.apache.hadoop.hbase.http.TestHttpServerLifecycle
Seems like that was a zombie test.

Integrated to master branch.

Thanks for the patch.
Thanks for the quick review

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12673435/0001-Fix-findHangingTests.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12673435

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Ted Yu, can we run this script and attach the output of the script to the end of Hadoop QA bot? I am not sure how to that but, it would be useful for people to identify hanging tests.

Here are two sample runs:


TYus-MacBook-Pro:trunk tyu$ python dev-support/findHangingTests.py https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5622/consoleFull

Fetching the console output from the URL

Printing hanging tests

Printing Failing tests

Failing test : org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.regionserver.TestRegionReplicaReplicationEndpoint

Fetching the console output from the URL

Printing hanging tests

Hanging test : org.apache.hadoop.hbase.http.TestHttpServerLifecycle

Printing Failing tests

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12673443/0001-Fix-findHangingTests.patch
against trunk revision .

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5633 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5633/)
HBASE-12195 Fix dev-support/findHangingTests (Manukranth Kolloju) (tedyu: rev cab0819327cb719cb6932bb7d2c2e121e5aac03c)

  • dev-support/findHangingTests.py
  • dev-support/findHangingTest.sh
Thanks Ted Yu for reviewing this patch.

Do you fellas think this commit could be doing this to the builds – they fail on site (it passes locally for me)

/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build@2/dev-support/test-patch.sh: line 755: 7554 Killed $MVN compile site -DskipTests -D$

{PROJECT_NAME}

PatchProcess > $PATCH_DIR/patchSiteOutput.txt 2>&1

As far as I can grep, findHangingTest.sh not referenced anywhere in the code base. It seems to be a standalone tool people run. The change I made was findHangingTest.sh to findHangingTests.py . I am not sure if test-patch.sh should be affected due to this change.
Manukranth Kolloju Thanks for looking. I should have done it myself. Something else is up then.
